questions.question_text: If 5a is a factor of n!, and the greatest integer value of a is 6, what is the largest possible value of b such that 7b is a factor of the largest possible value of n!?
If a = 0.999, b = (0.999)^2 and c = √0.999, which of the following is the correct order of a, b and c?

options.A: a < b < c
options.B: a < c < b
options.C: b < c < a
options.E: c < a < b

questions.question_text: If p is the product of the reciprocals of integers from 150 to 250, inclusive, and q is the product of the reciprocals of integers from 150 to 251, inclusive, what is the value of (p⁻¹ + q⁻¹) in terms of p?
If x is the sum of all integers from 51 to 100, inclusive, what is the value of x?

If x is the sum of the reciprocals of the consecutive integers from 51 to 60, inclusive and y is the sum of the reciprocals of the consecutive integers from 61 to 70, inclusive, which of the following is correct? I. 1/x > 6, II. 1/y > 7, III. 1/y > 1/x

options.A: Only I
options.B: Only II
options.C: Only III
options.E: I, II and III

questions.question_text: A number 4p25q is divisible by 4 and 9; where p and q are the thousands and units digits, respectively. What is the minimum value of p/q?
If a and b are real numbers such that a percent of (a − 2b) when added to b percent of b equals 0, then which of the following statements must be true? I. a = b, II. a + b = 0, III. a − b = 1

options.A: Only I
options.B: Only II
options.C: Only III
options.E: Only II and III

options.B: Only II
options.C: Only I and II
options.E: I, II and III

options.A: Two
options.B: Three
options.C: Four
options.E: Seven

questions.question_text: If m ≥ 0.9, which of the following is a possible value of (1/√m)?

options.A: Only I
options.B: Only II
options.C: Only III
options.E: I, II and III

questions.question_text: The addition operation shown below displays the sum of the two-digit positive integers XY and YX. If X, Y, and Z are different digits, what is the value of the integer Z?
Suzy saves $20 per month. In each of the 30 months, she saves $20 more than she did in the previous month. What is the total amount she saved during the 30-month period?
If a sequence of numbers t₁, t₂, …, tₙ is such that t₁ = 0, t₂ = 2 and tₙ = tₙ₊₁ + 2tₙ₋₁ for n ≥ 1, what is the value of t₄?
If n is an integer such that n > 9, which of the following could be the remainder when (2 + 2² + 2³ + … + 2ⁿ) is divided by 3?

options.A: Only I
options.B: Only II
options.C: Only III
options.E: I, II and III

questions.question_text: A machine can be repaired for $1,200 and will last for one year, while a new machine would cost $2,800 and will last for two years. The average cost per year of the new machine is what percent greater than the cost of repairing the current machine?
An item is subject to a sales tax of 10 percent on the part of the price that is greater than $200. If a customer paid a sales tax of $10 on the item, what was the price of the item?
Item A is subject to a sales tax rate of $0.54 per $25. What is the sales tax rate, as a percent, for item B that is subject to four times as much as the sales tax rate for item A?

In the last lap, cyclist P increases his speed from 10 mph to 25 mph, while cyclist Q increases his speed from 8 mph to 24 mph. By what percent is the percent increase in speed of cyclist Q greater than the percent increase in speed of cyclist P?

In a certain year, Carrier X traveled 101,098 kilometers and consumed 9,890 liters of diesel fuel, while Carrier Y traveled 203,000 kilometers and consumed 24,896 liters of diesel fuel. Fuel mileage is defined as kilometers per liter of fuel. The mileage of Carrier X is approximately what percent greater or lesser than that of Carrier Y?
The list price of a bicycle is $456. The trader first decreased the price by 25 percent and then increased it by 25 percent. The final price of the bicycle is what percent of the list price?

To prepare a certain color, a paint dealer mixes 3.4 liters of red color into a base that is 68 liters. The paint manufacturer recommends mixing 0.7 liters per 10 liters of base. By what percent should the dealer increase the quantity of the paint to match the recommendation?
questions.template: Percentage increase to meet recommended ratio

questions.question_text: A Business Processing Outsourcing unit recruits 200 employees. Each is paid $7.50 per hour for the first 44 hours per week and 1 1/3 times that rate for hours in excess of 44. In a week where 30% work 30 hours, 40% work 44 hours, and the rest work 50 hours, what is the total remuneration for all employees?
questions.template: Weighted average calculation with overtime pay

questions.question_text: A retail company earned $5 million as commission on the first $35 million in sales and then $11 million as commission on the next $121 million in sales. By what percent did the ratio of commissions to sales decrease from the first sales segment to the next?
A sales representative earned 8% commission on sales up to $20,000 and x% commission on sales above $20,000. If his total commission on $24,000 of sales was $2,000, what is the value of x?
A shopkeeper could sell only (4/5)th of the stock at the rate of $3 per item. If 100 items were unsold, what was the total amount he received from the sale?
questions.template: Stock proportion and total sales calculation

questions.question_text: A trader bought 900 cartons of a certain ice cream brand at a cost of $20 per carton. If he sold (2/3)rd of the cartons for one and a quarter times their cost price and sold the remaining cartons at a loss of 20 percent of their cost price, what was the trader’s gross profit on the total sale?

A dealer sells only two brands of bicycles, brand A and brand B. The selling price of a brand A bicycle is $150, which is 60 percent of the selling price of a brand B bicycle. If the dealer sells 100 pieces of bicycles, and (3/5)th of which are brand B, what is the dealer’s total sales, in dollars, from the sale of bicycles?
questions.template: Weighted sales calculation with mixed items

questions.question_text: A trader bought a consignment at a purchase price of $800 and sold it for 20% less than the marked price. If the trader made a profit equivalent to 30% of the purchase price, what is the marked price of the consignment?
questions.template: Marked price determination from profit margin

questions.question_text: A small textile company buys machines to stitch garments, costing a total of $10,000. The per-unit cost of each garment is $2.50 and each is sold for $4.50. How many units must be sold to achieve break-even?
questions.template: Break-even analysis using fixed cost and unit contribution

questions.question_text: The average of five numbers is 24. If four of the numbers are 20, 22, 26, and 30, what is the fifth number?

If the average of 7 numbers increases by 3 when one number is replaced by a larger number, by how much was the number increased?
If the ratio of A to B is 3:5 and the ratio of B to C is 7:9, what is the ratio of A to C?
In a bag, the ratio of red marbles to blue marbles is 2:3. After 15 red marbles are added, the ratio becomes 3:4. How many blue marbles were originally in the bag?

options.A: 40 grams

questions.question_text:
What is the number of elements in set A?
Statement (1): Set A has 5 more elements than set B, and the union of A and B contains 50 elements with their intersection containing 15 elements.
Statement (2): The number of elements in set B is 30.
questions.template: Data Sufficiency – Determining the size of one set using union and intersection information

options.A: Statement (1) alone is sufficient, but statement (2) alone is not sufficient.
options.B: Statement (2) alone is sufficient, but statement (1) alone is not sufficient.
options.C: Statements (1) and (2) together are sufficient, but neither statement alone is sufficient.
options.E: Statements (1) and (2) together are not sufficient.

questions.question_text:
What is the total number of elements in A ∪ B?
Statement (1): Set A has 40 elements and set B has 35 elements.
Statement (2): The intersection A ∩ B has 15 elements.
questions.template: Data Sufficiency – Calculating the union of two sets from their individual sizes and the size of their intersection

options.A: Statement (1) alone is sufficient, but statement (2) alone is not sufficient.
options.B: Statement (2) alone is sufficient, but statement (1) alone is not sufficient.
options.C: Statements (1) and (2) together are sufficient, but neither statement alone is sufficient.
options.E: Statements (1) and (2) together are not sufficient.

questions.question_text:
What is the median of a data set?
Statement (1): The data set consists of 9 numbers arranged in increasing order as follows: {3, 5, 7, 9, 11, 13, 15, 17, 19}.
Statement (2): The first quartile is 7 and the third quartile is 15.
questions.template: Data Sufficiency – Determining the median using complete ordered data or quartile information

options.A: Statement (1) alone is sufficient, but statement (2) alone is not sufficient.
options.B: Statement (2) alone is sufficient, but statement (1) alone is not sufficient.
options.C: Statements (1) and (2) together are sufficient, but neither statement alone is sufficient.
options.E: Statements (1) and (2) together are not sufficient.

questions.question_text:
What is the standard deviation of a data set?
Statement (1): The variance of the data set is 25.
Statement (2): The mean of the data set is 10.
questions.template: Data Sufficiency – Determining standard deviation from the variance

options.A: Statement (1) alone is sufficient, but statement (2) alone is not sufficient.
options.B: Statement (2) alone is sufficient, but statement (1) alone is not sufficient.
options.C: Statements (1) and (2) together are sufficient, but neither statement alone is sufficient.
options.E: Statements (1) and (2) together are not sufficient.

questions.question_text:
What is the value of x?
Statement (1): 3x + 2 = 17.
Statement (2): x - 4 = 1.
questions.template: Data Sufficiency – Solving a single linear equation

options.A: Statement (1) alone is sufficient, but statement (2) alone is not sufficient.
options.B: Statement (2) alone is sufficient, but statement (1) alone is not sufficient.
options.C: Statements (1) and (2) together are sufficient, but neither statement alone is sufficient.
options.E: Statements (1) and (2) together are not sufficient.

questions.question_text:
What is the value of y?
Statement (1): 2y - 3 = 7.
Statement (2): y + 2 = 7.
questions.template: Data Sufficiency – Solving a simple linear equation presented in different forms

options.A: Statement (1) alone is sufficient, but statement (2) alone is not sufficient.
options.B: Statement (2) alone is sufficient, but statement (1) alone is not sufficient.
options.C: Statements (1) and (2) together are sufficient, but neither statement alone is sufficient.
options.E: Statements (1) and (2) together are not sufficient.

questions.question_text:
What is the value of z?
Statement (1): 2z + 3 = 11.
Statement (2): z - 1 = 3.
questions.template: Data Sufficiency – Determining a variable from two independent linear equations

options.A: Statement (1) alone is sufficient, but statement (2) alone is not sufficient.
options.B: Statement (2) alone is sufficient, but statement (1) alone is not sufficient.
options.C: Statements (1) and (2) together are sufficient, but neither statement alone is sufficient.
options.E: Statements (1) and (2) together are not sufficient.
